macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Leading Economic Index Declines for Fifth Straight Month
items.summary: The Conference Board's US Leading Economic Index (LEI) fell 0.3% in December 2025, marking five consecutive monthly declines and signaling continued economic softness into early 2026. Weak consumer expectations and new orders outweighed positive financial components.

items.title: FOMC Minutes Spark Hawkish Sentiment on Potential Rate Hikes
items.summary: FOMC minutes from February 19 revealed several participants open to rate hikes if inflation persists above target, fueling monetary policy doubts and contributing to cheapening bonds and stocks. Analysts downplay immediate hike risks amid labor market concerns.

items.title: Gold Price Hits $4,992 per Ounce, Up 0.71% Daily and 69.85% Yearly
items.summary: Gold rose to $4,992 per ounce as of February 19 morning, reflecting a $35 daily gain amid economic uncertainty. The surge underscores gold's role as a store of value, outperforming amid market volatility.

items.title: Dow Leaders Caterpillar, Honeywell, Chevron Post Double-Digit YTD Gains
items.summary: Caterpillar (+31.6%), Honeywell (+23.6%), and Chevron (+21.8%) lead the Dow Jones in 2026 YTD through February 18, driven by record earnings, production highs, and segment growth despite broader market treads water.

items.title: Indonesia's JCI Dips 0.43% as Basic Materials Sector Surges Nearly 3%
items.summary: Jakarta Composite Index closed down 0.43% at 8,274.08 on February 19, with basic materials up 2.85% leading six rising sectors, while technology fell 1.16%. Trading volume reached Rp26.24 trillion.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Trades in Mid-$66K Range Amid 47% Correction from October Highs
items.summary: Bitcoin is consolidating around $66,865 after a 47% drop from $126,198 highs, with AI models like ChatGPT and Grok forecasting a narrow range of $66,000-$66,800 on February 20 due to extreme fear and weak ETF inflows.

items.title: Ton Blockchain Announces AppKit Updates and Toncoin Livestream on February 20
items.summary: The Ton blockchain has updated its AppKit, with a 'Real Talk' livestream scheduled for February 20 at 4 PM UTC to discuss TON Pay, AI agents, Gateway developments, and ETH Denver.

items.title: iShares Issues 340,000 New Bitcoin ETPs for London Stock Exchange Trading
items.summary: iShares Digital Assets AG issued 340,000 bitcoin ETP securities (Tranche 80) at $6.75 each, set to trade on the London Stock Exchange's Main Market starting February 20, following UK regulatory changes allowing retail access.

items.title: Bitcoin Nears Critical $65,000 Support as Markets Brace for Potential Capitulation
items.summary: Bitcoin has declined to test support near $65,000 after breaking a bear flag pattern, with analysts warning of further downside risks amid ongoing market weakness.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Google Releases Gemini 3.1 Pro with Enhanced Reasoning Capabilities
items.summary: Google announced Gemini 3.1 Pro on Thursday, highlighting improved core reasoning and complex problem-solving, scoring 77.1% on ARC-AGI-2 benchmark compared to prior models' lower scores.

items.title: Cornell Develops AI Framework for Predicting High-Conductivity Battery Electrolytes
items.summary: Researchers at Cornell unveiled a new AI framework published Feb. 19 that predicts lithium-ion battery electrolyte performance with 65% reduced error, revealing chemical principles for better battery design.

items.title: IBM Ventures Invests in Quantum Software Startups SQK and QodeX Quantum
items.summary: IBM invested in SQK, focusing on hybrid quantum-classical algorithms for medical imaging, and QodeX Quantum, developing quantum-native AI models for machine learning workflows, to expand its quantum ecosystem.

items.title: Google CEO Pichai Highlights AI's Role in Scientific Breakthroughs and India Investments
items.summary: Sundar Pichai emphasized AI accelerating discoveries like AlphaFold for protein structures and announced a $15 billion AI hub in Visakhapatnam, India, to bridge the AI divide.

items.title: Data Contracts for AI Market Projected to Grow to $1.57 Billion in 2026
items.summary: The data contracts for AI market is expected to increase from $1.28 billion in 2025 to $1.57 billion in 2026, driven by a 23.1% CAGR amid rising AI data management needs.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: ByteDance Nears $6bn Sale of Moonton to Saudi’s Savvy Games
items.summary: ByteDance is close to selling Moonton, the studio behind Mobile Legends: Bang Bang, to Savvy Games for $6bn, strengthening Savvy’s mobile and esports portfolio. The deal could be announced this quarter.

items.title: Scopely Acquires Majority Stake in Breakout Mobile Hit Pixel Flow
items.summary: Scopely has agreed to buy a majority stake in the Istanbul-based team behind Pixel Flow, a rapidly rising mobile game that has reached millions of players and topped grossing charts.

items.title: Netmarble Announces Global Launch for StoneAge Idle Adventure
items.summary: Netmarble revealed the global launch date for its upcoming mobile idle RPG StoneAge Idle Adventure, expanding its portfolio of high-quality games.

items.title: RAM Shortages Hit Hardware: Steam Deck Outages, Switch 2 Price Hike Rumors
items.summary: Valve confirms intermittent Steam Deck OLED stock issues due to RAM shortages from AI demand; Nintendo may raise Switch 2 prices and Sony could delay its next console.

items.title: Chaos Theory Games Reveals Rusthaven, Follow-up to Crab God
items.summary: Chaos Theory Games announced Rusthaven, a new title focusing on a better future, following their environmentally-focused management sim Crab God.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Samsung Electronics and KT Verify X-MIMO Technology in 7 GHz Band for 6G Development
items.summary: Samsung Electronics, KT Corporation, and Keysight Technologies successfully verified eXtreme multiple-input multiple-output (X-MIMO) technology in the 7 GHz band, achieving high data rates with eight simultaneous streams in a real-world outdoor test environment. This milestone advances foundational technologies for ultra-fast 6G networks and immersive services.

items.title: Samsung Shares Surge on Reports of Negotiating $700 Ultrafast Chip Sales
items.summary: Samsung Electronics shares hit a record high, surging up to 4.7%, following reports of negotiations to sell a new generation of ultrafast chips at around $700—20-30% higher than previous models. The rally contributed to broader tech gains in Asia as AI valuation concerns eased.

items.title: Microsoft Signs 10.5GW Clean-Energy Deal to Power Data Center Expansion
items.summary: Microsoft secured a massive 10.5 gigawatt renewable energy agreement to support its hyperscale data center growth and sustainability goals. The deal highlights Big Tech's shift toward industrial-scale power procurement amid surging demand.

items.title: Alphabet Unveils New Fiber-Optic Routes to Expand Connectivity in India
items.summary: Alphabet announced several initiatives for India expansion, including new fiber-optic routes connecting the country to the US and Southern Hemisphere locations. This supports enhanced global network infrastructure.
